statement.p: Nathan is conducting market research on the cost of homeowners insurance. Nathan has determined that the average annual cost of homeowners insurance is 856, and that the distribution of costs is normally distributed with a standard deviation of 71.
a. Find the probability that a single randomly selected consumer spends more than 969 on homeowners insurance.
b. The cost of the middle 70 of homeowners insurance policies falls between (round to the nearest dollar):
c. The most expensive 14 of homeowners insurance policies cost at least how much annually?

b. For the middle 70 of the data, need the remaining 30 of the data split between the left and right tails of the distribution. So the lower bound of the range has \displaystyle{0.15} of the area to the left and the upper bound of the range has \displaystyle{0.15} of the area to the right, which means \displaystyle{0.85} to the left.
